While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history—both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.

Spell Turning (At Will).name: Spell Turning (At Will)
Spell Turning (At Will).description: This abjuration reflects spells cast at you back at their caster. When a spell targets you, you can spend a reaction to attempt to reflect it. This uses the rules for counteracting the spell, but if the spell is successfully counteracted, the effect is turned back on the caster. Whether or not the counteract attempt is successful, spell turning then ends. Spell turning can't affect spells that aren't targeted (such as area spells). If spell turning reflects a spell back at a caster who is also under the effect of spell turning, their spell turning can attempt to reflect their own spell back at you again; if they do so, their counteract attempt automatically succeeds.

True Seeing (Constant).name: True Seeing (Constant)
True Seeing (Constant).description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

Blink (At Will).name: Blink (At Will)
Blink (At Will).description:
You blink quickly between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. You gain resistance 5 to all damage (except force). You can Sustain the Spell to vanish and reappear 10 feet away in a random direction determined by the GM; the movement doesn't trigger reactions. At the end of your turn, you vanish and reappear as above.

Heightened (+2) The resistance increases by 3.

Dimension Door (At Will).name: Dimension Door (At Will)
Dimension Door (At Will).description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Telekinetic Maneuver (At Will).name: Telekinetic Maneuver (At Will)
Telekinetic Maneuver (At Will).description: With a rush of telekinetic power, you move a foe or something they carry. You can attempt to Disarm, Shove, or Trip the target using a spell attack roll instead of an Athletics check.

Torpor.name: Torpor
Torpor.description: Typically, a demilich is inert when encountered and doesn't take actions until its @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WG91Z5TiR6oO5FOw]{Contingency} reaction has been triggered.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

Contingency.name: Contingency
Contingency.description:
Teyam has one permanent 8th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WG91Z5TiR6oO5FOw]{Contingency} spell in effect with one of its arcane innate spells of 5th level or lower as the companion spell- typically @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Dimension Door}.

Trigger While Teyam is in torpor, a creature disturbs Teyam's remains, touches her treasure, or casts a spell that would affect Teyam.

Effect Teyam ends torpor, rolls initiative, and gains the effect of her contingency's companion spell. The contingency resets after 24 hours.

Countermeasures.name: Countermeasures
Countermeasures.description:
Trigger Teyam's turn begins.

Effect Teyam casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.zR67Rt3UMHKC5evy]{Blink}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8]{Fly}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning}, or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{True Seeing} on itself. It usually chooses spell turning unless it already has that spell in effect.

Telekinetic Whirlwind.name: Telekinetic Whirlwind
Telekinetic Whirlwind.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Telekinetic whirlwind activates when Teyam ends torpor. Loose debris in the area whip up into a whirling storm. This obscures vision, making any creature in the area concealed, and causes creatures in its area (except Teyam) to treat all creatures as concealed. Any creature other than Teyam that enters or begins its turn in the aura takes [[/r {2d12}[bludgeoning]]]{2d12 bludgeoning damage}.

Demilich Eye Gems.name: Demilich Eye Gems
Demilich Eye Gems.description:
A demilich has gemstone eyes that glow when the demilich is active. Each eye contains an 8th-level spell that targets one creature (usually one eye has @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze} and the other @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.BKIet436snMNcnez]{Polar Ray}). The demilich can Activate an eye. This uses the number of spellcasting actions the spell requires, and also requires command and envision components.

When the demilich casts a spell from a gemstone eye, that eye stops glowing for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, during which time that eye's spell can't be used. Occasionally, one or both of the two @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Q4o8pEdxSY0bnJQZ]{Demilich Eye Gems} can be harvested from a destroyed demilich as magic items.

Devour Soul.name: Devour Soul
Devour Soul.description:
Requirements A soul has been trapped in one of Teyam's blight quartz gems for 24 hours.

Effect Teyam consumes the soul. The soul is utterly destroyed, and Teyam regains HP equal to double the creature's level.

Mental Magic.name: Mental Magic
Mental Magic.description: Teyam can replace all material and somatic components for casting spells with verbal components, and can replace all Interact components for activating magic items with envision components.

Staff Gems.name: Staff Gems
Staff Gems.description: Teyam long ago absorbed the spells from a staff into gemstone nodules embedded in her skull, with larger nodules representing higher-level spells. She can cast any of the spells as though it were Activating the staff, and regains 1 charge per 4 hours spent in torpor, to a maximum of 10 charges. Teyam has the spells from a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.6m9niDjhA6tBfp5x]{Staff of Power}

Trap Soul.name: Trap Soul
Trap Soul.description:
Frequency once per day per gem

Effect Ten blight quartz gemstones on Teyam's skull can trap the souls of the living. The Activated gem casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul}. This bind soul can target and affect a dying creature instead of a corpse. The dying creature can attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43] save; if it succeeds, it doesn't die and its soul is not trapped but it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (or is unaffected entirely on a critical success). When the soul of a creature gets trapped, the creature's body swiftly turns to dust.

The gemstones work like the black sapphires used in bind soul, except that they can hold creatures of up to 17th level and have a value of 200 gp apiece. Teyam can Devour a Soul it has trapped.

+2 Resilient Adamantine Breastplate.name: +2 Resilient Adamantine Breastplate
+2 Resilient Adamantine Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half‑plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

Religious Symbol of Droskar.name: Religious Symbol of Droskar
Religious Symbol of Droskar.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements Ilssrah has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature.

Effect Ilssrah attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If she succeeds at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+30 #attack]]{+30} modifier against the target's AC, she applies the manacles.

Hammer the Chained.name: Hammer the Chained
Hammer the Chained.description:
Ilssrah attempts a melee Strike with Fleshroaster. If she hits, she also draws her light hammer, makes a melee Strike with it against the same target, and immediately returns it to her belt. She then resumes her grip on Fleshroaster. Both Strikes count toward Ilssrah's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until both Strikes have been made. If the hammer Strike hits, it deals damage as normal and the target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is clumsy 1 and stupefied 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Acid Flask (Greater) [Infused].name: Acid Flask (Greater) [Infused]
Acid Flask (Greater) [Infused].description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 3d6 persistent acid damage, and 3 acid splash damage. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.

Frost Vial (Greater) [Infused].name: Frost Vial (Greater) [Infused]
Frost Vial (Greater) [Infused].description:
The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals 3d6 cold damage and 3 cold splash damage, and the target takes a -10-foot penalty.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.nJRoiSyd67eQ1dYj]{Effect: Frost Vial (Greater)}

Thunderstone (Greater) [Infused].name: Thunderstone (Greater) [Infused]
Thunderstone (Greater) [Infused].description:
When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|name:Greater Thunderstone|showDC:all] saving throw with the listed DC or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 3d4 sonic damage and 3 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 28.

+2 Resilient Leather Armor.name: +2 Resilient Leather Armor
+2 Resilient Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

Formula Book.name: Formula Book
Formula Book.description: A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description: Zuferian's items listed as infused last for 24 hours, or until her next daily preparations.

Alchemical Formulas.name: Alchemical Formulas
Alchemical Formulas.description:
@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.jC8GmH0Un6vDxdMj]{Acid Flask (Greater)}

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.n5yTlTs63o53n3k6]{Alchemist's Fire (Greater)}

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.r2iTRbt1zpkAqHj2]{Bottled Lightning (Greater)}

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.bz8Y8bVUe7QfBk9g]{Darkvision Elixir (Greater)}

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.87AzvRja9uQOLJCC]{Deathcap Powder}

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.mYozcVg9fQY6zO7C]{Elixir of Life (Greater)}

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.intVPcEzbE9o4NQd]{Frost Vial (Greater)}

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.zo0ophqfKunJFxZN]{Lethargy Poison}

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.iRDCa4OVSTGUD3vi]{Purple Worm Venom}

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.5Qkz4RVJr2Kx3RL6]{Tanglefoot Bag (Greater)}

Expanded Splash.name: Expanded Splash
Expanded Splash.description: Zuferian's bombs that have the splash trait deal 8 extra splash damage, and splash to 10 feet.

Quick Alchemy.name: Quick Alchemy
Quick Alchemy.description: Zuferian creates a single alchemical item from her formula book. This item has the infused trait, but it remains potent only until the start of her next turn. With her typical preparations, she can use this ability 7 times per day.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: Zuferian Interacts to draw a bomb, then Strikes with it.

True Debilitating Bomb.name: True Debilitating Bomb
True Debilitating Bomb.description:
When Zuferian uses Debilitating Bomb, add the following to the list of effects Zuferian can choose from:

  • @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}
  • @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}
  • a -15-foot status penalty to Speeds.

If Zuferian instead applies one of the effects listed in Debilitating Bomb, the target avoids the effect only if the result of its saving throw is a critical success.

Uncanny Bombs.name: Uncanny Bombs
Uncanny Bombs.description: When Zuferian throws an alchemical item with the bomb trait, its range increment increases to 60 feet, Zuferian reduces any circumstance bonus to the target's AC from cover by 1, and Zuferian automatically succeeds at the flat check when targeting a concealed creature.

+1 Resilient Breastplate.name: +1 Resilient Breastplate
+1 Resilient Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half‑plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

Adroit Disarm.name: Adroit Disarm
Adroit Disarm.description: The Zephyr Guard attempts to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} a creature, with a +2 circumstance bonus to the roll. On a critical success, the guard can also deal their @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.grmaV4GdoGD7sKbn]{Scimitar} damage to the creature.

Hampering Shot.name: Hampering Shot
Hampering Shot.description: The Zephyr Guard makes a heavy crossbow Strike that deals one additional weapon damage die. If the Strike hits, the target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. These last for 1 round, or 2 rounds if the Strike was a critical success.

Subduing Strikes.name: Subduing Strikes
Subduing Strikes.description: A Zephyr Guard takes no penalty for making nonlethal attacks with a weapon that doesn't have the nonlethal trait. The guard's nonlethal Strikes against a creature that is not wielding a weapon deal an additional [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage}.

Intimidating Strike.name: Intimidating Strike
Intimidating Strike.description: Alak's blow not only wounds creatures but also shatters their confidence. He makes a melee Strike. If he hits and deals damage, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit.

Power Attack.name: Power Attack
Power Attack.description: Alak unleashes a particularly powerful attack that clobbers his foe but leaves him a bit unsteady. He makes a melee Strike. This counts as two attacks when calculating his multiple attack penalty. If this Strike hits, he deals an extra die of weapon damage.

Living Sap.name: Living Sap
Living Sap.description:
The tall sharinga trees of the Mwangi Expanse leak golden sap from their swollen, bulbous trunks, which coagulates when exposed to air. The toxic resin, which has a bitter taste, protects the tree from herbivorous insects and other animals, but in rare cases-usually in areas awash in positive energy or the influence of the First World-the sap gains a life of its own. Such "living sap" is a mindless ooze that attempts to smother and engulf just about anything that moves, from the bugs and small beasts that feed on its sharinga tree to larger creatures unlucky enough to stumble upon it. Due to its immunities to most forms of physical damage and its protectiveness of its mother tree, a living ooze is a nuisance to communities that rely on the sap of sharinga trees to make resin, rubber, and glue.

Jungle-dwelling alchemists such as gripplis cherish the sap of the sharinga tree for its unique adhesive properties. The sap has been used for centuries to create tanglefoot bags, glue, and hard resin. Residue collected from a living sap is even more fascinating from an alchemical standpoint. Though harvesting a living sap is very dangerous, some alchemists will risk death in order to procure these easily worked ingredients. To increase the odds of a successful harvest, such employers are often willing to supply offensive aids such as lesser frost vials; living sap hunters learned long ago that cold energy is effective against these creatures and luckily doesn't harm the harvestable reagents.

Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
Motion Sense 60 feet.description: Living sap can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

Adhesive Body.name: Adhesive Body
Adhesive Body.description: A creature that Strikes a living sap with a melee weapon must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:24] save or be disarmed of that weapon. If the creature critically fails, the weapon ends up in the living sap's space. A creature that hits a living sap with an unarmed attack must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:24] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the living sap until the end of its next turn.

Entangling Residue.name: Entangling Residue
Entangling Residue.description: A creature hit by a living sap's pseudopod Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:24] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until the end of the living sap's next turn.

Crucidaemon.name: Crucidaemon
Crucidaemon.description:
Of all the ways to die, crucidaemons represent perhaps one of the least desirable: death by torture. The fiend's shapely body, which appears to be sculpted from iron or mithril, belies a sinister wrath and love of inflicting pain. Crucidaemons particularly enjoy inflicting pain with their curved, serrated daggers, which are attached to their bodies via a chain that pierces each wrist.

A crucidaemon's existence is dedicated to subjecting its prey to an eternity of pain and terror. Unlike other daemons, many of which are eager to feed on mortal souls as soon as they can, the crucidaemon takes much greater pleasure in prolonging the agony of its victims. Oftentimes, a crucidaemon will inflict such torment and pain upon its prey that when the end finally comes, the victim tearfully thanks the daemon for the mercy of oblivion. An encounter with a crucidaemon that does not end with its death is far from over-crucidaemons have unequaled patience for those who dare oppose them.

Air Walk (Constant).name: Air Walk (Constant)
Air Walk (Constant).description: The target can walk on air as if it were solid ground. It can ascend and descend in this way at a maximum of a 45-degree angle.

Invisibility (At Will).name: Invisibility (At Will)
Invisibility (At Will).description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

Detect Alignment (Constant) (Good Only).name: Detect Alignment  (Constant) (Good Only)
Detect Alignment (Constant) (Good Only).description:
Your eyes glow as you sense aligned auras. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. You receive no information beyond presence or absence. You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment.

Only creatures of 6th level or higher-unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere-have alignment auras.

Heightened (2nd) You learn each aura's location and strength.

Phantom Pain (At Will).name: Phantom Pain (At Will)
Phantom Pain (At Will).description:
Illusory pain wracks the target, dealing 2d4 mental damage and @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Mental1d4.success]. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes full initial damage but no @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Damage}, and the spell ends immediately.

Failure The target takes full initial and Persistent Damage, and the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. If the target recovers from being Sickened, the Persistent Damage ends and the spell ends.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d4 and the Persistent Damage by 1d4.

Trap Dodger.name: Trap Dodger
Trap Dodger.description: Crucidaemons are all but impossible to fool with traps. Whenever a crucidaemon rolls a saving throw against a trap hazard, its degree of success is one better than it rolled.

Daemonic Trap Making.name: Daemonic Trap Making
Daemonic Trap Making.description: When the crucidaemon casts its innate @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.o0l57UfBm9ScEUMW]{Glyph of Warding} spell, it can store any arcane or divine spell of an appropriate level in the glyph, even if it can't otherwise cast the spell.

Flurry of Daggers.name: Flurry of Daggers
Flurry of Daggers.description: The crucidaemon makes two chained dagger Strikes against a single target. These attacks count toward the crucidaemon's multiple attack penalty and its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Manifest Dagger.name: Manifest Dagger
Manifest Dagger.description: The crucidaemon summons a new chained dagger to replace a destroyed one. A crucidaemon's daggers can't be disarmed, and they become non-magical when severed from the daemon or upon the daemon's death.

Aiudara Wraith.name: Aiudara Wraith
Aiudara Wraith.description: Dahak's influence in Alseta's Landing created a soul-draining effect that slays unprotected creatures within, transforming them into ghostly creatures known as aiudara wraiths, but these rare undead can rise within modern aiudara portals as well. Each time an individual travels through an aiudara, there's a chance their passage could leave a faint imprint of their subconscious in the network. Normally this imprint simply fades away, but when an aiudara is damaged or the individual is suffering from necromantic contagions, these imprints can accumulate and, in time, coalesce on the Astral Plane or within Alseta's Landing as a full-fledged aiudara wraith. The wraith is forced to live with an incomplete sense of self, always seeking its own memories and swiftly growing violent and vengeful as its quest to reclaim these ephemeral notions constantly meets with failure.

Teleportation Attachment.name: Teleportation Attachment
Teleportation Attachment.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet uses a teleportation effect

Effect The aiudara wraith teleports with the creature, arriving in an empty space of its choice adjacent to the triggering creature's destination. If the triggering effect targets multiple creatures, the aiudara wraith chooses which creature it arrives beside.

Dimensional Shunt.name: Dimensional Shunt
Dimensional Shunt.description:
The aiudara wraith's touch displaces creatures and flings them through space. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to dimensional shunt for 1 minute.

Success The creature is pushed 5 feet in a random direction.

Failure The creature is teleported 20 feet in a direction of the aiudara wraith's choice.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description: When an aiudara wraith damages a living creature with its spectral hand Strike, the aiudara wraith gains 18 temporary Hit Points and the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} as long as it is drained. Further damage dealt by the aiudara wraith's spectral hand Strikes increases the value of the drained and stupefied conditions by 1 each on a failed save, to a maximum of 10 for both.

Instantaneous Movement.name: Instantaneous Movement
Instantaneous Movement.description: An aiudara wraith moves by means of localized teleportation. An aiudara wraith's Stride does not have the move trait. When an aiudara wraith Strides, it reaches its destination within the range of its Speed immediately.

Mud Spider.name: Mud Spider
Mud Spider.description: Tarantulas are ambush predators, but will attack prey in the open.

Mudwalking.name: Mudwalking
Mudwalking.description: The mud spiders ignore difficult terrain from mud.

Giant Tarantula Venom.name: Giant Tarantula Venom
Giant Tarantula Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 8 rounds

Stage 1 1d6 poison (1 round)

Stage 2 1d6 poison, flat-footed, and clumsy 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 1d6 poison, flat-footed, and clumsy 2 (1 round)

Stage 4 1d6 poison and paralyzed (1 round).

Hair Barrage.name: Hair Barrage
Hair Barrage.description: The tarantula flicks its legs, flinging spiky hairs in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. This deals [[/r {4d6}[piercing]]]{4d6 piercing damage} with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true] save.

Keen Eyes.name: Keen Eyes
Keen Eyes.description: Calmont's eyes are sharp, allowing him to make out small details about @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or even @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures that others might miss. He gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to find @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} creatures within 30 feet of him. When Calmont target an opponent that is concealed from him or hidden from him, reduce the DC of the flat check to 3 for a concealed target or 9 for a hidden one.

Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: Calmont isn't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, or flanking creatures of level 3 or lower.

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets Calmont with an attack and he can see the attacker.

Requirements Calmont is not @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}

Calmont deftly dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
Quick Draw.description: Calmont draws his weapon and attacks with the same motion. He Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Calmont deals 1d6 extra damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: If Calmont used Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to Calmont on the first round of combat.

+2 Greater Resilient Chain Mail.name: +2 Greater Resilient Chain Mail
+2 Greater Resilient Chain Mail.description: A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

Oblivion Essence.name: Oblivion Essence
Oblivion Essence.description:
Created from a daemon's powdered soul gems or refined from the waters of Abaddon's rivers, oblivion essence causes victims to rapidly age and decay.

Activate A Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {8d6}[poison]]]{8d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {10d6}[poison]]]{10d6 poison damage}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and slowed 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {12d6}[poison]]]{12d6 poison damage}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, slowed 1 (1 round)

Perfect Will.name: Perfect Will
Perfect Will.description: If Uri rolls a success on a Will saving throw, he gets a critical success instead; if he rolls a critical failure on a Will save, he gets a failure instead.

Punish Imperfection.name: Punish Imperfection
Punish Imperfection.description:
Trigger A creature within Uri's reach fails an attack roll, saving throw, or skill check

Effect Uri makes an unarmed Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack hits, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} until the end of its next turn (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} on a critical failure).

Reactionary.name: Reactionary
Reactionary.description: Uri can use 2 reactions in a round, but he can't perform the same reaction more than once per round.

Slash and Slam.name: Slash and Slam
Slash and Slam.description: Uri makes two Strikes: one with his scimitar and one with his shield spikes. If both hit, the overwhelming power of the attack leaves the target @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} if one of the Strikes was a critical hit, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} if both Strikes were critical hits). These Strikes count as one attack for Uri's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Swift Capture.name: Swift Capture
Swift Capture.description:
Requirements Uri has @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.5zkoqnp6X5yPCXVy]{Manacles} in his possession and is adjacent to a creature

Effect Uri sheathes a weapon he's carrying, then attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.5zkoqnp6X5yPCXVy]{Manacles}. If Uri succeeds at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+36 #Manacles]]{+36 modifier} against the target's AC, he applies the @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.5zkoqnp6X5yPCXVy]{Manacles}.

Swift Slash.name: Swift Slash
Swift Slash.description: Uri Strides and makes a scimitar Strike at any point during the Stride.

Black Powder Bomb.name: Age of Ashes
Black Powder Bomb.description: Three bulky kegs of black powder placed at key locations in the temple are triggered to explode in unison, causing the entire structure to collapse into rubble and slide partially down the cliff face.
Black Powder Bomb.hazardDisable:
No special skills are required to disable this manually activated trap. As an Interact action, a PC can sweep aside some black powder to interrupt the fuse line, but this doesn't prevent Gerhard from activating a keg via blunderbuss. A keg that is removed from its position (either by being thrown over the cliff or merely carried away) retains its explosive potential, but as long as one of the three kegs are removed they no longer have the precise placement required to trigger a collapse-an explosion at this point merely inflicts fire damage in the appropriate areas but does not particularly damage the temple structure itself.

A keg's contents can be dispersed by scattering the gunpowder to the wind (most efficiently by pouring it over the cliff side) as a 2-action activity, or rendered permanently inert by pouring a gallon of water into the powder, inhibiting its explosive qualities. The kegs themselves can be destroyed with damage (note that the AC listed below for each keg takes into account the fact that Gerhard has wedged the kegs into nooks in the temple's stone flooring and walls), but note that any fire damage (including incidental fire damage from area effects like a fireball or Gerhard's blunderbuss) causes them to explode. At your option, other actions may be similarly effective at disabling this hazard.
Black Powder Bomb.hazardRoutine: If Gerhard lights the black powder fuse, it burns at a speed of 10 feet each round; when the fuse reaches a keg 6 rounds later, the black powder bomb explodes. The bomb explodes immediately if he shoots a barrel with his blunderbuss.

Caustic Vapor.name: Age of Ashes
Caustic Vapor.description: The door slams shut, and poison gas fills the room.
Caustic Vapor.hazardDisable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:36|name:Exorcise the Spirits|traits:mechanical,trap] (master) or @Check[type:religion|dc:36|name:Exorcise the Spirits|traits:mechanical,trap] (master) to exorcise the spirits

Lazurite-Infused Flesh.name: Lazurite-Infused Flesh
Lazurite-Infused Flesh.description: Falrok's flesh is infused with lazurite, and he gains the benefits undead creatures gain from this mineral at all times. When in an area infused with lazurite, such as the Sanctum of the Starved, these benefits increase to a +3 circumstance bonus to saving throws against positive effects. This infusion also grants Falrok his resistance to positive damage.

Opportune Backstab.name: Opportune Backstab
Opportune Backstab.description:
Trigger A creature within Falrok's melee reach is hit by a melee attack from one of his allies.

Effect When Falrok's enemy is hit by one of his allies, he capitalizes upon the distraction, making a Strike against the triggering creature.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements Falrok is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect Falrok devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r {8d6}[healing]]]{8d6 Hit Points}.

He can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Ghast Fever.name: Ghast Fever
Ghast Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {3d8}[negative]]]{3d8 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {3d8}[negative]]]{3d8 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Scoundrel.name: Scoundrel
Scoundrel.description: When Falrok successfully @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against melee attacks he attempts against it until the end of his next turn. On a critical success, the target is flat-footed against all melee attacks until the end of their next turn, not just Falrok's.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
[[/r {4d6}[precision]]]{4d6 Precision}

When the monster Strikes a creature that has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: Falrok jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Fire Shield (Constant).name: Fire Shield (Constant)
Fire Shield (Constant).description:
You wreathe yourself in ghostly flames, gaining cold resistance 5. Additionally, adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take 2d6 fire damage each time they do.

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.1RsScTvNdGD9zGWe]{Spell Effect: Fire Shield}

Heightened (+2) The cold resistance increases by 5, and the fire damage increases by 1d6.

Wall of Fire (At Will).name: Wall of Fire (At Will)
Wall of Fire (At Will).description:
You raise a blazing wall that burns creatures passing through it. You create either a 5-foot-thick wall of flame in a straight line up to 60 feet long and 10 feet high, or a 5-foot-thick, 10-foot-radius ring of flame with the same height. The wall stands vertically in either form; if you wish, the wall can be of a shorter length or height. Everything on each side of the wall is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from creatures on the opposite side. Any creature that crosses the wall or is occupying the wall's area at the start of its turn takes 4d6 fire damage.

Heightened (+1) The fire damage increases by 1d6.

Burning Hands (At Will).name: Burning Hands (At Will)
Burning Hands (At Will).description:
Gouts of flame rush from your hands. You deal 2d6 fire damage to creatures in the area.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

Wing Deflection.name: Wing Deflection
Wing Deflection.description:
Trigger Veshumirix is targeted with an attack.

Effect Veshumirix raises his wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If Veshumirix is Flying, he descends 10 feet after the attack.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
Veshumirix breathes a blast of magma that deals [[/r {9d6}[fire]+{4d12}[bludgeoning]]]{9d6 fire damage and 4d12 bludgeoning damage} in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60]{60-foot cone} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true] save).

He can't use Breath Weapon again for [/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: Veshumirix makes two claw Strikes and one horns Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: Veshumirix recharges his Breath Weapon whenever he scores a critical hit with a Strike.

Magma Swim.name: Magma Swim
Magma Swim.description: A magma dragon's swim Speed functions only when the dragon is swimming through magma or molten lava.

Volcanic Purge.name: Volcanic Purge
Volcanic Purge.description:
If the next action Veshumirix uses is Breath Weapon, the magma clings to those it damages. Each creature that fails its save against the Breath Weapon takes [[/r {4d6}[persistent,fire]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}, and as long as it has this persistent fire damage, it also takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.7qoZauizAKfPIXeu]{Effect: Volcanic Purge}

Manacles (Average) (Marked with the Symb.name: Manacles (Average) (Marked with the Symbol of the Scarlet Triad)
Manacles (Average) (Marked with the Symb.description: You can manacle someone who is willing or otherwise at your mercy as an exploration activity taking 10-30 seconds depending on the creature's size and how many manacles you apply. A two‑legged creature with its legs bound takes a -15‑foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds, and a two‑handed creature with its wrists bound has to succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] any time it uses a manipulate action or else that action fails. This DC may be higher depending on how tightly the manacles constrain the hands. A creature bound to a stationary object is immobilized. For creatures with more or fewer limbs, the GM determines what effect manacles have, if any. Freeing a creature from average manacles requires four successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:27|traits:action:pick-a-lock] checks.

Spellbook.name: Spellbook
Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

Timely Distraction.name: Timely Distraction
Timely Distraction.description:
Trigger A creature Heuberk can see within his melee reach misses him with a melee Strike.

Effect Heuberk attempts to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} the creature. If it's not Heuberk's turn and he gets a success, the effect applies on his next turn.

Identify an Opening.name: Identify an Opening
Identify an Opening.description:
Requirements A creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against Heuberk's next melee attack.

Effect Heuberk points out a lapse in the creature's defenses. The creature is flat-footed against all melee attacks attempted by any of Heuberk's allies who hear and understand this instruction until the start of Heuberk's next turn.

+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor
+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

Stunning Retort.name: Stunning Retort
Stunning Retort.description:
Trigger An enemy critically fails a Strike against the enforcer

Effect The enforcer Strikes with their sap against that enemy if they're within reach; otherwise, the enforcer attempts an Intimidation check to Demoralize that enemy.

Dual Abuse.name: Dual Abuse
Dual Abuse.description:
The enforcer uses the pain of one attack as an opening to deal a devastating second blow. The enforcer makes two attacks against the same target: a scimitar Strike and sap Strike (in any order) or two composite shortbow Strikes. If both attacks hit, the second attack deals an additional [[/r {3d6}]]{3d6 damage}, and the enforcer gives the target one of the following conditions until the end of the enforcer's next turn: @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

This counts as two attacks when calculating the enforcer's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements The enforcer has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature

Effect The enforcer attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If the enforcer succeeds at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+30 #Manacles]]{+30 modifier} against the target's AC, they apply the manacles.

Wand of Crushing Despair (Level 5).name: Wand of Crushing Despair (Level 5)
Wand of Crushing Despair (Level 5).description:
@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]{Crushing Despair}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane Magic

Dahak's Skull.name: Age of Ashes
Dahak's Skull.description: A pair of magical gems inside the dragon skull's eye sockets act as magical sensors with a 30-foot radius.
Dahak's Skull.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:27|name:Pry Out the Embedded Gems|traits:complex,magical,fire,trap,hazard] (expert) two times to pry the gems embedded deep in the skull's eye sockets without triggering the sensor, or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level, counteract DC 22) twice to dispel both eyes.
Dahak's Skull.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) On its initiative, Dahak's skull fires up to two eye beams; it must target a different creature with each attack. The eye beams can't target creatures directly below the skull.

Damurdiel's Vengeance.name: Age of Ashes
Damurdiel's Vengeance.description: An elven woman wearing a robe stands in the water. She beckons anyone who enters the room to join her in the pool.
Damurdiel's Vengeance.hazardDisable: Deception 45 (legendary) to pretend to be Erveniss and ask for forgiveness, Diplomacy 45 (legendary) to convince Damurdiel to stand down (elves who are masters in Diplomacy can attempt the check as if they were legendary instead), or Religion 40 (legendary) to call upon Calistria to calm Damurdiel's spirit.
Damurdiel's Vengeance.hazardReset: Damurdiel's spirit subsides once she is destroyed or if she manages to reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points. She returns after 1 minute.
Damurdiel's Vengeance.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The haunt attempts to Strike with the dagger.

Aluum Enforcer.name: Aluum Enforcer
Aluum Enforcer.description:
The most common aluum is powered by the bound soul of a loyal city servant, but its creation is among the Pactmasters' most guarded secrets. There are dozens of dormant aluums spread throughout Katapesh, and only someone wearing an aluum charm can activate and command one of these 14-foot-tall soldiers. The Pactmasters entrust few beyond the Zephyr Guard to carry these charms, and stealing such a charm is one of the most severe crimes in the city.

Aluums are powerful metal and stone constructs originally created by the Pactmasters to maintain order in Katapesh. The construction of each aluum includes the creation of an @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.bU731I8njNmSAQhQ]{Aluum Charm}, a brass pendant set with a blue crystal designed to control that particular construct. The charm constructed at the same time as an aluum is called its linked charm.

Aluum Antimagic.name: Aluum Antimagic
Aluum Antimagic.description: Aluum enforcers are immune to spells and magical abilities, with two exceptions. A negative spell or magical ability grants an aluum enforcer the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects. A positive spell or ability makes an aluum enforcer @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects.

Paralyzing Force.name: Paralyzing Force
Paralyzing Force.description: A creature damaged by the aluum enforcer's fist Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed for [[/r 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes } and falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Soul Shriek.name: Soul Shriek
Soul Shriek.description:
The aluum enforcer emits a keening wail in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r {9d6}[sonic]]]{9d6 sonic damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:27|basic:true] save). A creature that fails its save is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure.

The aluum can't use Soul Shriek again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Bida.name: Bida
Bida.description:
Bidas are black-scaled dragons with long, serpentine bodies and bat-like wings. Their legs and claws are smaller than those of most dragons, but their powerful undulating coils, like those of a boa constrictor, are potent weapons capable of squeezing the life from several unfortunate victims at a time.

A bida uses its impressive intellect and powerful magic to pose as a humanoid and infiltrate a settlement. Over the course of weeks or months, it establishes itself as a key member of the village, and only after it has become invaluable to the community does it reveal the terrible price of its assistance: regular offerings of flesh and gold. From this point on, the bida dwells almost exclusively within its smoggy lair, growing fat off the blood of its sacrificial offerings. To hide its presence from the outside world, a bida conceals its enslaved settlement in a large-scale illusion, leaving only a stand of jungle trees where once a thriving village may have been and ordering the townsfolk to destroy any roads in and out of town.

Bidas begrudgingly tolerate others of their kind, instead preferring the company of their small, tasty thralls. In rare cases, a pair of bidas may join forces to conquer a particularly large settlement, extracting that much more wealth from the populace as a result of their partnership.

+2 Circumstance to All Saves to Disbelie.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves to Disbelieve Illusions

Eight Coils.name: Eight Coils
Eight Coils.description: A bida can Strike with its tail even while Grabbing creatures with it. The bida can have up to eight Medium or smaller creatures grabbed with its tail at a time; it can also grab Large creatures, but they count as four Medium creatures for this purpose.

Mask Settlement.name: Mask Settlement
Mask Settlement.description: By concentrating for 4 hours, the bida hides a small settlement. This is a 5th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Hallucinatory Terrain} spell, except the area is a @Template[type:burst|distance:500] and creatures are invisible while inside structures in the area. The bida can conceal only one settlement at a time, and must concentrate on the effect for 10 minutes at the beginning of each day to maintain the illusion.

Contingency.name: Contingency
Contingency.description:
Trigger Emaliza is attacked

Effect A 5th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Dimension Door} spell is cast on Emaliza; she uses this to escape an attack that she fears would incapacitate or kill her.

Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Emaliza hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect Emaliza can cast one prepared spell she has already cast today without spending a spell slot.

Warded Casting.name: Warded Casting
Warded Casting.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger Emaliza Casts a Spell

Effect Emaliza's magic creates a small defensive aura around her. She gains 20 temporary Hit Points and resistance 20 to either acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage. The defensive aura remains until the beginning of her next turn.

Echoes of Betrayal.name: Age of Ashes
Echoes of Betrayal.description: Malevolent spirits led by a ghostly image of Ludika rise and begin a deadly brawl. These spirits attempt to overwhelm living creatures, forcing them to join the battle.
Echoes of Betrayal.hazardDisable: @Check[type:religion|dc:35|name:Exorcise|traits:haunt,complex] (master) three times to exorcise the spirits or @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:39|name:Talk Down|traits:haunt,complex] (expert) three times to talk them down.
Echoes of Betrayal.hazardReset: After 24 hours, the haunt returns. The spirits are permanently put to rest only if a lawfully appointed judge from Saggorak (or Kovlar) comes into the prison, takes damage from the haunt, and survives the attack.
Echoes of Betrayal.hazardRoutine: (1 action) As 1 action, the haunt causes a barrage of ghostly fists to lash from the walls, floors, and ceiling. The haunt attempts a spectral fist Strike against each creature in area H10.

+2 Greater Resilient Full Plate.name: +2 Greater Resilient Full Plate
+2 Greater Resilient Full Plate.description: Plate mail consists of interlocking plates that encase nearly the entire body in a carapace of steel. It is costly and heavy, and the wearer often requires help to don it correctly, but it provides some of the best defense armor can supply. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.

Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
Attack of Opportunity.description:
Rinnarv can use Attack of Opportunity when a creature within his reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. He can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and he disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

Blood Magic.name: Blood Magic
Blood Magic.description: When Rinnarv casts one of his bloodline spells or a spell from his list of granted spells, he creates an aura that protects himself or one of the targets of the spell. The aura grants a +1 status bonus to saving throws for 1 round.

Spell Strike.name: Spell Strike
Spell Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger Rinnarv begins to Cast a Spell that targets at least 1 creature

Effect Rinnarv channels his spell through his blade. He makes a Strike with his blade against a target within reach. If the Strike is successful, the target is automatically subject to the spell. If the spell required an attack roll, the target is hit. If the spell required a saving throw, the target takes a -4 status penalty to its saving throw instead. If the spell could target multiple creatures, it targets only the creature Rinnarv hit with his Strike.

Lay on Hands (Vs. Undead).name: Lay on Hands (Vs. Undead)
Lay on Hands (Vs. Undead).description:
Your hands become infused with positive energy, healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch.

If you use lay on hands on a willing living target, you restore 6 Hit Points; if the target is one of your allies, they also gain a +2 status bonus to AC for 1 round.

Against an undead target, you deal 1d6 damage and it must attempt a basic Fortitude save; if it fails, it also takes a -2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing increases by 6, and the damage to an undead target increases by 1d6.

Divine Providence.name: Divine Providence
Divine Providence.description:
Trigger Jahsi rolls a success on a Will save against an enemy's effect.

Effect Jahsi gets a critical success instead.

Glimpse of Redemption.name: Glimpse of Redemption
Glimpse of Redemption.description:
Trigger An enemy damages one of Jahsi's allies within 15 feet of him.

Effect The foe must choose one: The ally is unharmed by the triggering damage, or the ally gains resistance 10 against the triggering damage, and the enemy is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of its next turn.

Dragonstorm.name: Age of Ashes
Dragonstorm.description: A massive storm stirs in the skies above Breachill and Citadel Altaerein. As specific events begin during the three waves of the manifestation's retribution, the dragonstorm wreaks localized havoc.
Dragonstorm.hazardDisable: The dragonstorm can't be disabled-only endured. It ends only once the attack on Breachill and Citadel Altaerein is over.

Luminous Ward.name: Age of Ashes
Luminous Ward.description: A burst of radiance explodes from the door.
Luminous Ward.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:40|name:|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable the wards or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 38) to counteract the ward

Fly (Constant).name: Fly (Constant)
Fly (Constant).description:
The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

Heightened (7th) The duration increases to 1 hour.

Illusory Disguise (At Will).name: Illusory Disguise (At Will)
Illusory Disguise (At Will).description:
You create an illusion that causes you to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as yourself. The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. You can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making your armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item you remove returns to its true appearance.

Casting illusory disguise counts as setting up a disguise for the @Compendium[pf2e.action-macros.k5nW4jGyXD0Oq9LR]{Impersonate} use of Deception; it ignores any circumstance penalties you might take for disguising yourself as a dissimilar creature, it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and you add your level even if you're untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.

Heightened (2nd) The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

Heightened (3rd) You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

@Compendium[pf2e.spell-effects.3Ktyd5F9lOPo4myk]{Spell Effect: Illusory Disguise}

Illusory Object (At Will).name: Illusory Object (At Will)
Illusory Object (At Will).description:
You create an illusory visual image of a stationary object. The entire image must fit within the spell's area. The object appears to animate naturally, but it doesn't make sounds or generate smells. For example, water would appear to pour down an illusory waterfall, but it would be silent.

Any creature that touches the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

Heightened (2nd) Your image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the auditory trait. The duration increases to 1 hour.

Heightened (5th) As the 2nd-level version, but the duration is unlimited.

Ventriloquism (At Will).name: Ventriloquism (At Will)
Ventriloquism (At Will).description:
Whenever you speak or make any other sound vocally, you can make your vocalization seem to originate from somewhere else within 60 feet, and you can change that apparent location freely as you vocalize. Any creature that hears the sound can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

Heightened (+2) The spell's duration increases to 1 hour, and you can also change the tone, quality, and other aspects of your voice. Before a creature can attempt to disbelieve your illusion, it must actively attempt a Perception check or otherwise use actions to interact with the sound.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Ishti can take on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage modifiers with her Strikes, but it does prevent them from using her cursed touch. Ishti has a fixed humanoid form-they cannot adopt a different appearance each time they use this ability, and the appearance resembles that of their upper torso when in their true form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Matriarch's Caress.name: Matriarch's Caress
Matriarch's Caress.description:
Ishti touches a creature, who must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:40] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} if it critically fails).

If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (or 2 if it critically fails) (to a maximum of stupefied 4). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.

Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
Poison Weapon.description: Ishti applies a poison to a piercing or slashing weapon of her choice.

Quick Dervish Strike.name: Quick Dervish Strike
Quick Dervish Strike.description: Ishti makes a dagger attack against each enemy within reach. Each attack counts toward her multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after all the attacks. The first enemy she damages is subject to matriarch's caress.

Acid Flask (Major) [Infused].name: Acid Flask (Major) [Infused]
Acid Flask (Major) [Infused].description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 4d6 persistent acid damage, and 4 acid splash damage. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

Alchemist's Fire (Major) [Infused].name: Alchemist's Fire (Major) [Infused]
Alchemist's Fire (Major) [Infused].description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 4d8 fire damage, 4 persistent fire damage, and 4 fire splash damage. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

Bottled Lightning (Major) [Infused].name: Bottled Lightning (Major) [Infused]
Bottled Lightning (Major) [Infused].description:
Activate A Strike

Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals 4d6 electricity damage and 4 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of your next turn. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

Frost Vial (Major) [Infused].name: Frost Vial (Major) [Infused]
Frost Vial (Major) [Infused].description:
The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals 4d6 cold damage and 4 cold splash damage, and the target takes a -15-foot penalty.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.4G9qnI0oRyL6eKFQ]{Effect: Frost Vial (Major)}

+2 Greater Resilient Chain Shirt.name: +2 Greater Resilient Chain Shirt
+2 Greater Resilient Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

Formula Book.name: Formula Book
Formula Book.description:
Contains formulas for all common alchemical items of 19th level or lower.

A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

Bestial Mutagen (Major) [Infused].name: Bestial Mutagen (Major) [Infused]
Bestial Mutagen (Major) [Infused].description:
Activate 1 Interact

Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy.

Benefit You gain a +4 item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack ([[/r {1d8}[slashing]]]{1d8 slashing damage}) with the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack ([[/r {1d10}[piercing]]]{1d10 piercing damage}). You gain the weapon specialization with the claws and jaws, or greater weapon specialization, if you already have weapon specialization with these unarmed attacks.

Drawback You take a -1 penalty to AC and a -2 penalty to Reflex saves.

Duration 1 hour.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.1ouUo8lLK6H79Rqh]{Effect: Bestial Mutagen (Major)}

Juggernaut Mutagen (Major) [Infused].name: Juggernaut Mutagen (Major) [Infused]
Juggernaut Mutagen (Major) [Infused].description:
Activate A Interact

After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant.

Benefit You gain a +4 item bonus to Fortitude saves and 45 temporary Hit Points. Whenever you are at maximum Hit Points for at least 1 full minute, you regain the temporary Hit Points. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save you get a critical success instead, and you critical failures on Fortitude saves become failures instead.

Drawback You take a -2 penalty to Will saves, Perception checks and initiative rolls.

Duration 1 hour.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.2PNo8u4wxSbz5WEs]{Effect: Juggernaut Mutagen (Major)}

Elixir of Life (True) [Infused].name: Elixir of Life (True) [Infused]
Elixir of Life (True) [Infused].description:
Activate A

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r {10d6+27}[healing]]]{10d6+27 Hit Points} and gain +4 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.9MeHc072G4L8AJkp]{Effect: Elixir of Life (True)}

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description:
Ingnovim carries

4 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.GttLYMT2welSpwCd]{Acid Flask (Major)}

4 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.cLZrOihPht5M7eTw]{Alchemist's Fire (Major)}

2 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.nS75vsM3x5jxlUqn]{Bestial Mutagen (Major)}

4 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.rpbbfkexLhtadBDV]{Bottled Lightning (Major)}

4 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.4DJQID8GIlxQ7b9C]{Frost Vial (Major)}

2 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.1kNp6yOS0aZPBPzZ]{Juggernaut Mutagen (Major)}

4 @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.qK964kZz1ALcysOa]{Elixir of Life (True)}

These items last for 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations.

Inject Unstable Mutagen.name: Inject Unstable Mutagen
Inject Unstable Mutagen.description:
Trigger Ingnovim damages a creature with a syringe Strike

Effect The creature injected with unstable mutagen must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save to resist the injection.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Failure The target's body shifts and mutates, growing difficult to control; the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 24 hours.

Critical Failure The target's body completely distorts into a shuddering blob of warped flesh that is incapable of action; the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. Every 24 hours, the target may attempt a new saving throw against this effect; on a critical success, the paralysis ends.

Mutagenic Adaptation.name: Mutagenic Adaptation
Mutagenic Adaptation.description: Ingnovim's body has adapted to the constant use of his mutagens. He does not suffer the drawback of any bestial mutagens but is still affected normally by other mutagens.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: Ingnovim draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

+1 Striking Staff of Necromancy (Greater.name: +1 Striking Staff of Necromancy (Greater)
+1 Striking Staff of Necromancy (Greater.description:
This twisted and grim-looking staff is adorned with hideous skull and bone motifs. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify necromancy magic.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]{Chill Touch}
  • 1st @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a]{Grim Tendrils}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]{Ray of Enfeeblement}
  • 2nd @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.fZPCv2VHuM2yPbC8]{Deafness}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Gentle Repose}
  • 3rd @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.N1Z1oLPdBxaSgrEE]{Vampiric Touch}
  • 4th @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a]{Grim Tendrils}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.N1Z1oLPdBxaSgrEE]{Vampiric Touch}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

Bones of Stone.name: Bones of Stone
Bones of Stone.description:
Requirements The target is standing on or adjacent to a stone surface.

Frequency once per round

Effect Jaggaki calls upon unquiet spirits within the land, causing a giant skeletal arm made of jagged stone to reach out of a stone surface adjacent to a creature within 60 feet. Jaggaki makes a hand Strike against the target via this stone arm rather than using his own hand. If the Strike hits, it deals [[/r {4d6}[bludgeoning]]]{4d6 additional bludgeoning damage}.

Drain Soul Cage.name: Drain Soul Cage
Drain Soul Cage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Jaggaki taps into his @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest level he can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells.

Jaggaki's soul cage doesn't need to be present for him to use this ability.

Paralyzing Touch.name: Paralyzing Touch
Paralyzing Touch.description:
A creature damaged by the Jaggaki's hand Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save.

The creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A @Check[type:medicine|dc:25|name:Diagnose Paralysis] check reveals the victim is alive.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt Jaggaki's spellcasting action, Jaggaki attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check. If he succeeds, his action isn't disrupted.

+1 Resilient Leather Armor.name: +1 Resilient Leather Armor
+1 Resilient Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements The Scarlet Triad agent has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature.

Effect The Scarlet Triad agent attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. If they succeed at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+24]]{+24 modifier} against the target's AC, they apply the manacles.

Precise Debilitations.name: Precise Debilitations
Precise Debilitations.description:
Trigger The Scarlet Triad agent's Strike hits a flat-footed creature and deals damage.

Effect The Scarlet Triad agent applies one of the following debilitations to the creature, which lasts until the end of their next turn.

  • Brow Gash The target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed}.
  • Deep Cut The target takes an additional [[/r 2d6[precision]]]{2d6 precision damage} from the Scarlet Triad agent's attacks.
  • Hamstring The target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.
  • Low Blow The target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.otUESSH8BDdPKHtb]{Effect: Hamstring}

Weapon Trick.name: Weapon Trick
Weapon Trick.description: When the Scarlet Triad agent critically succeeds at an attack roll against a @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} creature, they apply the critical specialization effect for the weapon they are wielding.

Spiritbound Aluum.name: Spiritbound Aluum
Spiritbound Aluum.description:
Whereas most aluums are animated by the souls of volunteers loyal to Katapesh, the Pactmasters created a handful of more capable (and deadly) aluums powered by the souls of a dozen or more dangerous criminals. These spiritbound aluums are rarely used as peacekeepers, instead serving as assassins, elite bodyguards, or riot control during times of martial law.

A spiritbound aluum has a dull blue crystalline focus that stores constituent souls, surrounded by a host of smaller gems used for trapping souls the Pactmasters wish to deny from entering the Great Beyond. Spiritbound aluums rarely use this soul-binding ability except when instructed by their masters. However, the murderous or embittered souls within the aluum sometimes exert control and willfully consume a departing soul either out of malice or to incorporate it into the construct's core. If not relieved of its trapped souls in a timely manner, a spiritbound aluum can develop enough will to overcome its masters' orders and even awaken to full sentience. These rogue aluums typically lose the mindless trait, are evil, have an Intelligence modifier of -2 or higher, and gain several skills with bonuses ranging from +25 to +32.

Aluums are powerful metal and stone constructs originally created by the Pactmasters to maintain order in Katapesh. The construction of each aluum includes the creation of an @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.bU731I8njNmSAQhQ]{Aluum Charm}, a brass pendant set with a blue crystal designed to control that particular construct. The charm constructed at the same time as an aluum is called its linked charm.

Aluum Antimagic.name: Aluum Antimagic
Aluum Antimagic.description: Spiritbound aluums are immune to spells and magical abilities, with two exceptions. A negative spell or magical ability grants a spiritbound aluum the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects. A positive spell or ability makes a spiritbound aluum @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn instead of its normal effects.

Obliteration Beam.name: Obliteration Beam
Obliteration Beam.description:
Requirements The spiritbound aluum has bound a soul using its @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul} innate spell

Effect The spiritbound aluum transforms the captured soul's essence into raw magical energy, channeling the spirit into a beam that deals [[/r {20d6}[force]]]{20d6 force damage} in a @Template[type:line|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:38|basic:true] save). The remaining fragments of the captured soul are released to the Great Beyond.

The spiritbound aluum can't use Obliteration Beam again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Paralyzing Force.name: Paralyzing Force
Paralyzing Force.description: A creature damaged by the Spirtibound Aluum's fist Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/r 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes} and falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Soul Binder.name: Soul Binder
Soul Binder.description:
When a spiritbound aluum uses its @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul} innate spell, it binds the soul into its central crystal instead of the normal material component. The crystal can hold up to 60 souls.

When encountered, a spiritbound aluum's crystal typically contains [[/br 1d6 #souls]]{1d6 souls}.

Soul Shriek.name: Soul Shriek
Soul Shriek.description:
The aluum enforcer emits a keening wail in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r {16d6}[sonic]]]{16d6 sonic damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:27|basic:true] save). A creature that fails its save is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure.

The aluum can't use Soul Shriek again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Manacles (Good) (Marked with the Symbol.name: Manacles (Good) (Marked with the Symbol of the Scarlet Triad)
