Manacles (Good) (Marked with the Symbol.description: You can manacle someone who is willing or otherwise at your mercy as an exploration activity taking 10-30 seconds depending on the creature's size and how many manacles you apply. A two‑legged creature with its legs bound takes a -15‑foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds, and a two‑handed creature with its wrists bound has to succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] any time it uses a manipulate action or else that action fails. This DC may be higher depending on how tightly the manacles constrain the hands. A creature bound to a stationary object is immobilized. For creatures with more or fewer limbs, the GM determines what effect manacles have, if any. Freeing a creature from good manacles requires five successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:32|traits:action:pick-a-lock] checks.

Giant Scorpion Venom (Applied to Bolts).name: Giant Scorpion Venom (Applied to Bolts)
Giant Scorpion Venom (Applied to Bolts).description:
Scorpion venom is excruciating and its effects are somewhat debilitating.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|name:Giant Scorpion Venom]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d10}[poison]]]{1d10 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d10}[poison]]]{2d10 poison damage} and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {2d10}[poison]]]{2d10 poison damage} and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Poison.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Poison

Running Poison Strike.name: Running Poison Strike
Running Poison Strike.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The poisoner Strides, poisoning their weapon as they move. The poisoner moves up to their Speed and makes a melee Strike that deals [[/r {2d8}[poison]]]{2d8 extra poison damage}. This has no effect on a Strike that already deals poison damage.

Gloomglow Mushrooms.name: Age of Ashes
Gloomglow Mushrooms.description: A field of grass-like fungal filaments amid clusters of softly glowing, long-stalked mushrooms.
Gloomglow Mushrooms.hazardDisable: @Check[type:survival|dc:22|name:Clear Patch of Mushrooms|traits:environmental,fungus,hazard] (expert) to remove a 5-foot-patch without triggering the mushrooms.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
Belmazog spews a gout of acid that deals [[/r {10d6}[acid]]]{10d6 acid damage} in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save).

Belmazog can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Drowning Drone.name: Drowning Drone
Drowning Drone.description:
Trigger Belmazog or one of her allies within 60 feet attempts a saving throw against an auditory or sonic effect.

Effect Belmazog releases a croak that drowns out other sound. She rolls a Performance check. She and boggard allies in the area can use the higher result of her Performance check or their saves to resolve the effects against the auditory or sonic effect.

Nul-Acrumi Vazghul Ritual.name: Nul-Acrumi Vazghul Ritual
Nul-Acrumi Vazghul Ritual.description: This rare and highly specialized ritual, taught to Belmazog by the Scarlet Triad, allowed her to use the fossilized remains of Dahak to erect powerful defenses in the region in the form of dragon pillars, but the resources and time required to perform the ritual again are not available to Belmazog during the course of this adventure. As a result, and since there is no way for the PCs to learn or benefit from the ritual, further information beyond the repercussions detailed in the adventure itself are not presented here.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description: Belmazog ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Terrifying Croak.name: Terrifying Croak
Terrifying Croak.description: Belmazog unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within 30 feet becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:28] save; those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description: If Belmazog hits a creature with her tongue, that creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by Belmazog. Unlike with a normal grab, the creature isn't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of Belmazog's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 25 and dealing at least 8 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to Belmazog, it prevents her from using her tongue Strike until she regrows her tongue, which takes a week.

Sterling Blacksmith's Tools.name: Sterling Blacksmith's Tools
Sterling Blacksmith's Tools.description:
You need these tools to create items from raw materials with the Craft skill. Sterling artisan's tools give you a +1 item bonus to the check.

Different sets are needed for different work, as determined by the GM; for example, blacksmith's tools differ from woodworker's tools.

Master Smith.name: Master Smith
Master Smith.description: As the most skillful blacksmith in Kovlar, Kelda's abilities far surpass those of typical smiths. She can Craft items as if she were 16th level. Additionally, she knows how to make a vast catalog of items, including numerous uncommon formulas and several rare formulas. The exact formulas she knows can be tailored to fit the needs of each particular group of PCs, but most are for weapons, armor, and other items that could reasonably be made in a forge.

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description:
Rusty Mae adds @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Passwall}, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Bonds of Iron.name: Bonds of Iron
Bonds of Iron.description: Once per day, Rusty Mae can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring out of nothingness at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, Rusty Mae gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal Grapple, Rusty Mae doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature escapes (DC 29), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it. It has an AC of 25, Hardness 14, and 56 Hit Points.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Rusty Mae can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Rust.name: Rust
Rust.description: Rusty Mae's claws cause metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If she succeeds at a claws Strike or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} attempt, she deals [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage} (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness, in addition to the damage she deals to the target with her claws. If she hits an unattended metal item, the item takes [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage} automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against Rusty Mae's claw attack, the shield is automatically @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}, but no other item is affected on that attack.

Anadi Venom.name: Anadi Venom
Anadi Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage}, flat-footed, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Renali changes into their true form, spider form, or human form. The above statistics assume Renali is in her true form. While in human form, Renali can't use her fangs attack and loses her climb Speed. When in spider form, she can't use weapons.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Spin Silk.name: Spin Silk
Spin Silk.description: By spending several minutes, an anadi can produce silk to craft items made of cloth. A single anadi can produce enough silk in a day to craft a single garment.

Emperor Bird.name: Emperor Bird
Emperor Bird.description:
The emperor bird is native to the jungles of the Mwangi Expanse and known for its brilliant plumage and innate magic. While it usually feeds on lizards, big insects, and other small creatures, the emperor bird is highly territorial and not afraid to attack larger prey. Its beak, resembling that of the much smaller peafowl, is exceptionally sharp, but its deadliest weapon is its tail-the long, whiplike blades of bone hidden among its tail feathers are a nasty surprise for any predator trying to sneak up on the bird.

The emperor bird was given its current name 2,000 years ago when Taldor's Sixth Army of Exploration ventured into the Mwangi Expanse. When the legion spotted this 6-foot-long bird with its spectacular multicolored feathers trailing from its tail, wings, and crest, the soldiers thought the bird regal enough to suit their emperor, disregarding the name the Mwangi had given to the bird generations before, bebaki.

Keeping an emperor bird was, for many years, a sign of prestige among the nobility of Taldor. That was long ago, however, and emperor birds eventually fell out of fashion. Inevitably their former owners forgot about their colorful pets, and hundreds of neglected emperor birds were released back into the wild by weary servants. While many such freed birds perished quickly in the unfamiliar woodlands of Avistan, some managed to hold out, and emperor birds can still be encountered in the Verduran Forest.

The emperor bird uses its brilliant, iridescent plumage for mating displays as well as for intimidating rival suitors and potential predators. Not only are the feathers beautiful, but they are actually magical-a fact that has piqued the interest of alchemists and wizards alike, many of whom have spent decades capturing and breeding emperor birds in the hope of unlocking their arcane secrets. Mages stationed in the Mwangi Expanse will pay a pretty penny for intact feathers from these majestic creatures-or better yet, live specimens.

Dazzling Display.name: Dazzling Display
Dazzling Display.description:
The emperor bird flaps its mesmerizing wings. Each creature within 15 feet that can see the emperor bird must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is dazzled for [[/br 1d4 #Dazzled Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/br 1d4 #Confused Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.

Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
Tail Lash.description: The emperor bird makes tail Strikes against two different creatures within reach. The emperor bird's multiple attack penalty does not increase until it has finished both attacks.

Endless Elven Aging.name: Age of Ashes
Endless Elven Aging.description: A haunted mural fascinates characters and swiftly drains their vitality.
Endless Elven Aging.hazardDisable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:38|name:Calm the Restless Energies|traits:haunt,magical] (master) or @Check[type:religion|dc:38|name:Calm the Restless Energies|traits:haunt,magical] (master) to calm the restless energies and suppress the haunt for 1 hour; a critical success deactivates the haunt permanently.
Endless Elven Aging.hazardReset: The haunt continues its routine until there are no targets within 30 feet of the room. It then resets over the course of 1 minute and is able to activate again.
Endless Elven Aging.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) The haunt lures creatures into area A2 using Captivate. Any actions it hasn't used to Captivate are used to drain a living creature in the room with Live a Thousand Lives.

Summon Fiend (Hell Hound Only).name: Summon Fiend (Hell Hound Only)
Summon Fiend (Hell Hound Only).description:
You conjure a fiend to fight on your behalf. This works like summon animal, except you summon a common creature that has the fiend trait and whose level is 5 or lower. You can't summon a creature unless its alignment is one of your deity's preferred alignments (or, if you don't have a deity, is within one step of your alignment). At the GM's discretion, some deities might restrict specific types of fiends, even if their alignments match.

Heightened (6th) Level 7

Heightened (7th) Level 9

Heightened (8th) Level 11

Heightened (9th) Level 13

Heightened (10th) Level 15

Summon Fiend (Augur Velstrac Only).name: Summon Fiend (Augur Velstrac Only)
Summon Fiend (Augur Velstrac Only).description:
You conjure a fiend to fight on your behalf. This works like summon animal, except you summon a common creature that has the fiend trait and whose level is 5 or lower. You can't summon a creature unless its alignment is one of your deity's preferred alignments (or, if you don't have a deity, is within one step of your alignment). At the GM's discretion, some deities might restrict specific types of fiends, even if their alignments match.

Heightened (6th) Level 7

Heightened (7th) Level 9

Heightened (8th) Level 11

Heightened (9th) Level 13

Heightened (10th) Level 15

+1 Clothing (Explorer's).name: +1 Clothing (Explorer's)
+1 Clothing (Explorer's).description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

The Extraplanar Registry.name: The Extraplanar Registry
The Extraplanar Registry.description: This book is written in Infernal. Anyone who can read it can use this detailed tome to gain a +2 item bonus to Recall Knowledge about outsiders, but it has a greater value-contained within its pages are full details on three rituals: @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.7DN13ILADW2N9Z1t]{Commune}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2CNqkt2s2IYkVnv6]{Imprisonment}, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.vgy00hnqxN9VoeoF]{Planar Ally}.

Manacles (Good) (Marked with the Symbol.name: Manacles (Good) (Marked with the Symbol of the Scarlet Triad)
Manacles (Good) (Marked with the Symbol.description: You can manacle someone who is willing or otherwise at your mercy as an exploration activity taking 10-30 seconds depending on the creature's size and how many manacles you apply. A two‑legged creature with its legs bound takes a -15‑foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds, and a two‑handed creature with its wrists bound has to succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] any time it uses a manipulate action or else that action fails. This DC may be higher depending on how tightly the manacles constrain the hands. A creature bound to a stationary object is immobilized. For creatures with more or fewer limbs, the GM determines what effect manacles have, if any. Freeing a creature from good manacles requires five successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:32|traits:action:pick-a-lock] checks.

Keys to Each Dormitory Door and Slave Ma.name: Keys to Each Dormitory Door and Slave Manacles

Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Barushak hasn't acted yet on this turn.

Effect This turn, Barushak can cast one prepared spell he has already cast today without spending a spell slot. He must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

Efficient Capture.name: Efficient Capture
Efficient Capture.description:
Requirements Barushak has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature.

Effect Barushak attempts to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. He must succeed at an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+21 #Manacles]]{+21} modifier against the target's AC.

Fiend Summoner.name: Fiend Summoner
Fiend Summoner.description: Barushak can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} spells as arcane spells. Each time he does so, sinister energies flow through his body, causing his eyes to glow red and making him @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 3 rounds. He can use the extra action only to Sustain the Spell.

Superlative Summoner.name: Superlative Summoner
Superlative Summoner.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt Barushak's spellcasting action, Barushak attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check. If he succeeds, his action isn't disrupted.

Imprisoned.name: Imprisoned
Imprisoned.description: Dahak's manifestation can't physically exit the Adamantine Fen until conditions are right. Planar travel effects do not allow it to escape, nor can they banish it from the Adamantine Fen.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a red dragon's vision; it ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Dragonstorm Aura.name: Dragonstorm Aura
Dragonstorm Aura.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

[[/r {2d6}[acid] + {2d6}[cold] +{2d6}[electricity] +{2d6}[fire] +{2d6}[poison]]]{10d6 damage split evenly between acid, cold electricity, fire, and poison}.

Redirect Energy.name: Redirect Energy
Redirect Energy.description:
Trigger A creature within 100 feet casts an acid, cold, fire, electricity, or poison spell, or such a spell otherwise comes into effect from a source within 100 feet

Effect The manifestation of Dahak makes all the choices to determine the targets, destination, or other effects of the spell, as though it were the caster.

Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

Dragonstorm Breath.name: Dragonstorm Breath
Dragonstorm Breath.description: The manifestation of Dahak breathes a blast of dragonstorm energy that deals [[/r {5d6}[acid] + {5d6}[cold] +{5d6}[electricity] +{5d6}[fire] +{5d6}[poison]]]{5d6 acid, 5d6 cold, 5d6 electricity, 5d6 fire, and 5d6 poison damage} in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:48|basic:true|traits:fire,acid,cold,electricity,poison] save). It can't use Dragonstorm Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Focused Breath Weapon.name: Focused Breath Weapon
Focused Breath Weapon.description: The manifestation breathes a blast of energy that deals [[/r {12d12}]]{12d12 damage} in a @Template[type:line|distance:90] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:44|basic:true] save). The type of damage this Breath Weapon deals can be acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison, as chosen by the manifestation when it attacks. The manifestation can't use its focused Breath Weapon again for 2 rounds, and the next time it uses its Breath Weapon, it must deal a different type of damage than the previous usage.

Dragonscarred Dead.name: Dragonscarred Dead
Dragonscarred Dead.description:
Not all would-be dragonslayers who die a valiant death rest peacefully amid the annals of legend. Sometimes, a draconic necromancer is so impressed by its fallen foe that the dragon ritually raises the dead warrior to serve the dragon in undeath. These undead guardians are infused with a fraction of the power of the dragon who slew them, channeling the same energy as their draconic masters' breath.

Dragonscarred dead are similar to skeletal champions or graveknights in that they are not merely reanimated servants who mindlessly follow orders, but are instead powerful wardens who maintain the same agency they bore in life. While a dragonscarred dead is often magically compelled to follow its reanimator's commands, some of these undead dragonslayers manage to escape their masters and pursue their own vile agendas-which may involve rallying allies to challenge their draconic creator once more and finish the dire mission they started in life.

Broken Greatsword.name: Broken Greatsword
Broken Greatsword.description: This immense two‑handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close‑quarter fights.

Guardian Sense.name: Guardian Sense
Guardian Sense.description: The dragonscarred dead is immediately aware of any intruder that enters the lair of its creator dragon. It does not know the exact location of the intruder but remains aware of the intruder's presence until the intruder either leaves or is destroyed.

Breath-Seared Sword.name: Breath-Seared Sword
Breath-Seared Sword.description: The dragonscarred dead's weapon is magically scorched by a dragon's breath. When wielded by the dragonscarred dead who carried it in life, the sword deals an extra [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and [[/r {3d6}[fire]]]{3d6 fire damage}. In the hands of any other creature, it is merely a broken greatsword.

Glare of Rage.name: Glare of Rage
Glare of Rage.description:
The dragonscarred dead focuses its boundless frustration in a gaze targeting one creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:30] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is stunned for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Barzillai's Hounds.name: Age of Ashes
Barzillai's Hounds.description: Hell hounds invisible to all but their lone target burn their chosen victim.
Barzillai's Hounds.hazardDisable: @Check[type:religion|dc:24|name:Exorcise the Hounds|traits:complex,haunt,hazard] (expert) to perform an exorcism (with 2 actions)
Barzillai's Hounds.hazardReset: If their designated target dies or the hounds can't reach it in a turn, the hounds vanish into noxious smoke, but they manifest again elsewhere in the city after the next sunset.
Barzillai's Hounds.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) The haunt uses its first action to Stride (Speed 60 feet), then its second action for a jaws Strike against its designated target if it is in reach. If the target is not in reach, the haunt resets.

Nolly's Hoe (+1 Striking Anarchic Halfli.name: Nolly's Hoe (+1 Striking Anarchic Halfling Sling Staff)
Nolly's Hoe (+1 Striking Anarchic Halfli.description: This staff ends in a Y‑shaped split that cradles a sling. The length of the staff provides excellent leverage when used two‑handed to fling rocks or bullets from the sling.

+1 Leather Armor.name: +1 Leather Armor
+1 Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

Halfling Luck.name: Halfling Luck
Halfling Luck.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Nolly fails a skill check or a saving throw.

Effect Nolly rerolls the triggering check, but she must use the new result, even if it's worse.

Inspiring Presence.name: Inspiring Presence
Inspiring Presence.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Allies within 30 feet of Nolly gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saves against fear effects.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.UxeoSRmPbD5hjiEi]{Effect: Inspiring Presence}

Designate Bellflower Crop.name: Designate Bellflower Crop
Designate Bellflower Crop.description:
Nolly designates an ally within 30 feet as a member of her Bellflower crop. Nolly can have up to 10 members in her crop at once; any member added in excess of this number automatically removes a crop member of Nolly's choice. When Nolly or a member of her crop @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aids} a crop member and rolls a success, they get a critical success to Aid instead.

When a crop member within 60 feet of Nolly fails a saving throw against an effect that would impose the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} condition, the crop member can use a reaction to reroll the saving throw and use the better of the two results. This is a fortune effect.

Liberating Trick.name: Liberating Trick
Liberating Trick.description: Nolly frees herself or a creature within her reach from the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} condition.

Quick Movements.name: Quick Movements
Quick Movements.description: Nolly doesn't trigger reactions with her movement or with any use of the Thievery skill.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Nolly deals an extra 3d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Seismic Spears Trap.name: Age of Ashes
Seismic Spears Trap.description: Lines of searing lava lance through the area, causing targets to shake as if caught in an earthquake and potentially become petrified.
Seismic Spears Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:43|name:Disable the Wards|traits:magical,trap] (master) to disable the wards or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 38) to counteract the ward.

Forge-Spurned.name: Forge-Spurned
Forge-Spurned.description: Evil dwarves who die having failed to live up to the exacting standards of the duergar god Droskar are sometimes forced to return to the material world as undead abominations known as forge-spurned.

Soul Chain.name: Soul Chain
Soul Chain.description:
If a creature is slain by an attack from the soul chain and the forge-spurned is able to retain the creature's corpse, it can bind the creature's soul into the soul chain (as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul}) with a day of work at a forge and a @Check[type:crafting|dc:20|name:Soul Chain Bind] check.

An individual whose soul is bound in this way can't be resurrected unless the soul chain is destroyed (Hardness 10, 40 HP, BT 20).

Enternal Damnation.name: Enternal Damnation
Enternal Damnation.description: As long as its soul chain remains intact, a forge-spurned can't be truly destroyed. It rises again fully healed at the next sundown, even if its physical body was destroyed.

Searing Heat.name: Searing Heat
Searing Heat.description: A creature that touches the forge-spurned (including @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grappling} it or hitting it with an unarmed attack) takes [[/r {2d6}[fire]]]{2d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save).

Forge Breath.name: Forge Breath
Forge Breath.description:
The forge-spurned breathes a cloud of stinging soot, ash, and glowing embers. This can affect either a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] or a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] centered on the forge-spurned and persists for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Each creature that moves into or starts their turn in the area takes [[/r {6d6}[fire]]]{6d6 fire damage}, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save. A creature that fails its save is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute.

Creatures within the cloud are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, though not from the forge-spurned.

The forge-spurned can't use Forge Breath again until it has used Inflate Bellows.

Inflate Bellows.name: Inflate Bellows
Inflate Bellows.description:
Requirements The forge-spurned has used Forge Breath.

Effect The forge-spurned re-inflates its flaccid lungs, enabling it to use Forge Breath again.

Town Hall Fire.name: Age of Ashes
Town Hall Fire.description: A fire engulfs the western door and a @Template[type:line|distance:10|width:10]{10-foot-by-10-foot area} immediately east of it, then spreads on each of its turns.
Town Hall Fire.hazardDisable:
Eliminating the hazard requires dousing the flames. Water typically clears a 5-foot square if the amount is small (such as that from @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WzLKjSw6hsBhuklC]{Create Water} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.jfVCuOpzC6mUrf6f]{Hydraulic Push}). Larger amounts of water, such as a full bucket, typically douse a @Template[type:line|distance:10|width:10]{10-foot-by-10-foot area} (or 4 squares in some other shape). Throwing a bucket of water on flames requires an Interact action. A waterskin doesn't contain enough water to put out even 1 square of fire. Cold can also put out fire, but only if the cold can affect an area; cold is usually less effective than water, so a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.EpxmUtLpCkE8R6KJ]{Frost Vial} typically puts out 1 square of fire, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost} is ineffective.

Fountain Circle, located outside town hall, has several working water pumps. These are far enough away that it's impractical for a PC to bring water back and forth. However, a PC might instruct the more steely nerved spectators to create a bucket brigade. It takes 15 spectators (which can include those rescued by councilors as well as by PCs) to set this up, and 2 rounds for the townspeople to line up and begin pumping water from Fountain Circle. As of the 3rd round, there is a bucket of water available for the PCs to use at the chamber's southern entrance at the beginning of each PC's turn. Members of a bucket brigade are lined up outside the chamber, and don't take damage from smoke inhalation.

If a PC does want to carry the water, it's 150 feet from the chamber's southern door to a pump, so it 6 actions are usually needed to reach the pumps or return. Filling a bucket requires an Interact action.

Other methods might also help control the fire, as you determine. For example, the PCs might be able to find something to barricade the fire with to control its path, or use a cloak to beat out some of the fire.
Town Hall Fire.hazardRoutine:
On its turn, the fire spreads into a number of additional squares equal to half the number of squares the fire currently occupies, with a minimum of 1 square. You determine the squares the fire spreads into-typically those with the most flammable materials. Any creature that ends its turn next to the flames takes [[/r {1d6}[fire]]]{1d6 fire damage}, and any creature within the flames takes [[/r {4d6}[fire]]]{4d6 fire damage}. Both of these have a @Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true|traits:complex,environmental,fire,hazard] save. A creature can take damage from flames only once per round. (For simplicity, track damage only for the NPCs and their allies, not for the spectators; Turn 5 and Turn 7 have instructions regarding the spectators' health).

The fire has an additional effect on each of its turns after the first.

Turn 2 The chamber's northern door flies open and flames burst through, igniting the @Template[type:line|distance:10|width:10]{10-foot-by-10-foot area} in front of the door. All fires spread on subsequent turns, at the same rate listed above. Any fires that join together become one fire for this purpose.

Turn 4+ Creatures in the room take [[/r 1d6 #Smoke Inhalation Damage]]{1d6 damage} from smoke inhalation at the ends of their turns. Anyone who uses an Interact action to tie a wet rag around their nose and mouth (or uses another creative solution) halves the damage.

Turn 5 Spectators still inside the room fall @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} from burns and smoke inhalation.

Turn 7 Spectators still in the room die.

+1 Resilient Breastplate.name: +1 Resilient Breastplate
+1 Resilient Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half‑plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

Improved Knockdown.name: Improved Knockdown
Improved Knockdown.description: A corrupt guard can dash their foe to the ground with a single blow. They attempt a single melee Strike. If this Strike hits, they also apply the critical success effect of a Trip. If they used a two- handed melee weapon (such as a maul) for the Strike, they can use the weapon's damage die size instead of the regular die size for the damage from a critical Trip, and they ignore Trip's requirement to have a hand free.

Vazgorlu.name: Vazgorlu
Vazgorlu.description: The arthropod monstrosity known as a vazgorlu makes its home on the Astral Plane or inside of a stable portal, ambushing creatures that travel there using dimensional magic.

Plane Shift (To and From the Vazgorlu's.name: Plane Shift (To and From the Vazgorlu's Demiplane Only)
Plane Shift (To and From the Vazgorlu's.description: You and your allies traverse the barriers between planes of existence. The targets move to another plane, such as the Plane of Fire, the Shadow Plane, or the Abyss. You must have specific knowledge of the destination plane and use a magic tuning fork created from material from that plane as a focus for the spell. While the tuning forks for most prominent planes are uncommon, just like the spell plane shift, more obscure planes and demiplanes often have rare tuning forks. The spell is highly imprecise, and you appear 1d20x25 miles from the last place one of the targets (of your choice) was located the last time that target traveled to the plane. If it's the first time traveling to a particular plane for all targets, you appear at a random location on the plane. Plane shift doesn't provide a means of return travel, though casting plane shift again allows you to return to your previous plane unless there are extenuating circumstances.

Air Walk (constant).name: Air Walk (constant)
Air Walk (constant).description: The target can walk on air as if it were solid ground. It can ascend and descend in this way at a maximum of a 45-degree angle.

Dimension Door (At Will).name: Dimension Door (At Will)
Dimension Door (At Will).description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Hostile Juxtaposition.name: Hostile Juxtaposition
Hostile Juxtaposition.description:
Trigger A creature targets the vazgorlu with a Strike

Effect The vazgorlu chooses a different creature within 60 feet and attempts to swap places with that creature using @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Dimension Door} in the instant before the Strike. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:39|traits:arcana] save.

Critical Success The target resists the teleportation, and the vazgorlu can't use Hostile Juxtaposition for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Success The target resists the teleportation.

Failure The target and the vazgorlu instantly swap places, and the triggering Strike is resolved against the target instead.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is transported to the vazgorlu's demiplane after resolving the triggering Strike against it.

Demiplane Lair.name: Demiplane Lair
Demiplane Lair.description: A vazgorlu maintains a 30-foot-diameter demiplane in the Astral Plane. Gravity in this demiplane pulls out from the center, so that creatures can walk upon the inner surface. A vazgorlu's demiplane lair lacks a built-in point of exit, and if the vazgorlu fails to visit the demiplane during a 24-hour period, the demiplane collapses- all objects and creatures within are then returned to their original locations in the multiverse before they entered the demiplane. A vazgorlu can create a replacement demiplane lair with 24 hours of concentration.

Dimensional Tether.name: Dimensional Tether
Dimensional Tether.description: A creature hit by a vazgorlu's web Strike is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it Escapes (DC 42). As long as it remains immobilized by the web, the web attempts to counteract any effect that would move the webbed creature to another plane, with a counteract level of 10 and using the vazgorlu's [[/r 1d20+38 #Dimensional Tether Counteract]]{Arcana} skill to attempt the counteract check.

Redirect Portal.name: Redirect Portal
Redirect Portal.description: A vazgorlu can spend 10 minutes in contact with a magical portal to redirect it, causing the portal to instead lead to its demiplane lair. To do so, the vazgorlu must succeed at a [[/r 1d20+41 #Redirect Portal]]{Portal Lore} check (the DC is either equal to the caster's spell DC for a portal created by a spell, or set by the portal's level; if the portal in question has no level listed, assume it's a 20th-level portal).

Graveshell.name: Graveshell
Graveshell.description:
The graveshell is a dangerous predator that draws scavengers and explorers into its grasp using a morbid lure: the corpse of a former victim impaled upon the spikes that protrude from its large, turtle-like shell. Aside from its shell, the monster resembles no known animal. Small but bright yellow eyes watch from the sagging flesh of its head, the most prominent feature of which is a curiously shaped, toothy maw twisted into a perpetual grin. Its stubby arms and legs are impractical for both walking and swimming, though the algae-caked claws tipping each limb are deadly weapons.

Graveshells are intelligent-a fact that surprises many who encounter them-and surrender rather than fight to the death. These monsters have little to offer in exchange for their lives, though the waterlogged treasures on their collection of corpses may entice opportunists.

Corpse Disguise.name: Corpse Disguise
Corpse Disguise.description: The graveshell conceals its true nature over the course of a few minutes by impaling a corpse (typically humanoid) on its spiky shell before partially submerging itself in water. It has an automatic result of 22 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a corpse floating in the water.

Shell Block.name: Shell Block
Shell Block.description:
Trigger The graveshell takes damage from a physical attack while withdrawn into its shell

Effect The graveshell reduces the damage from the attack by an amount equal to its shell's Hardness. A graveshell's shell has a Hardness of 6, 10 Hit Points, and a Broken Threshold of 5. If its shell is broken, the graveshell can't attack with shell spikes, nor can it use Shell Game. If the shell is destroyed, the graveshell's AC is reduced to 16. As long as a graveshell is alive, its shell naturally repairs itself after a week.

Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: The graveshell can hold its breath for 200 rounds (20 minutes).

Shell Game.name: Shell Game
Shell Game.description: The graveshell withdraws into its shell, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and allowing it to use Shell Block. This lasts until the graveshell moves or attacks with any attack other than its shell spikes. The graveshell can't take this action or get any benefit from it if its shell is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}.

Soul Chain.name: Soul Chain
Soul Chain.description:
If a creature is slain by an attack from the soul chain and the accursed forge-spurned is able to retain the creature's corpse, it can bind the creature's soul into the soul chain (as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Bind Soul}) with a day of work at a forge and a @Check[type:crafting|dc:20|name:Soul Chain Bind] check.

An individual whose soul is bound in this way can't be resurrected unless the soul chain is destroyed (Hardness 10, 40 HP, BT 20).

+2 Resilient Full Plate.name: +2 Resilient Full Plate
+2 Resilient Full Plate.description: Plate mail consists of interlocking plates that encase nearly the entire body in a carapace of steel. It is costly and heavy, and the wearer often requires help to don it correctly, but it provides some of the best defense armor can supply. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.

Eternal Damnation.name: Eternal Damnation
Eternal Damnation.description: As long as its soul chain remains intact, the accursed forge-spurned can't be truly destroyed and rises again fully healed at the next sundown, even if its physical body was destroyed.

Searing Heat.name: Searing Heat
Searing Heat.description: A creature that touches the accursed forge-spurned (including @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grappling} it or hitting it with an unarmed attack) takes [[/r {4d6}[fire]]]{4d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:33|basic:true] save).

Forge Breath.name: Forge Breath
Forge Breath.description:
The accursed forge-spurned breathes a cloud of stinging soot, ash, and glowing embers. This can affect either a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] or a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] centered on the accursed forge-spurned and persists for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Creatures that move into or start their turn in the area take [[/r {12d6}[fire]]]{12d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true] save).

A creature that fails its save is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute. Creatures within the cloud are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, though not from the accursed forge-spurned.

The accursed forge-spurned can't use Forge Breath again until it has used Inflate Bellows.

Inflate Bellows.name: Inflate Bellows
Inflate Bellows.description:
Requirements The accursed forge-spurned has used Forge Breath.

Effect The accursed forge-spurned re-inflates its flaccid lungs, enabling it to use Forge Breath again.

Soul Siphon.name: Soul Siphon
Soul Siphon.description:
When the accursed forge-spurned critically hits a target with its soul chain, the chain leeches away a portion of the target's soul. The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure The target is drained 2 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} from the pain.

Shrieking Frenzy.name: Shrieking Frenzy
Shrieking Frenzy.description:
Trigger The charau-ka's turn begins.

Frequency once per hour

Effect The charau-ka is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of its turn, and can use the extra action to Stride or Strike. Due to its loud wailing while in a shrieking frenzy, the charau-ka can't speak and automatically critically fails all Stealth checks.

Thrown Weapon Mastery.name: Thrown Weapon Mastery
Thrown Weapon Mastery.description: When a charau-ka throws a weapon, the weapon gains the deadly d6 weapon trait. When it throws an improvised weapon, it doesn't take the -2 penalty for using an improvised weapon, nor does it take the penalty for using that weapon to make a lethal attack instead of a nonlethal attack.

Vulnerable to Dispelling.name: Vulnerable to Dispelling
Vulnerable to Dispelling.description: The animated dragonstorm can be targeted by disjunction and dispel magic. If targeted by such a spell of 9th level or higher, the construct loses its resistance to acid, cold, electricity, fire, and physical damage and is slowed 1 for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Channel Dragonstorm.name: Channel Dragonstorm
Channel Dragonstorm.description: The animated dragonstorm directs a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of dragonstorm energy. This deals [[/r {3d8}[acid] + {3d8}[cold] +{3d8}[electricity] +{3d8}[fire] +{3d8}[poison]]]{3d8 acid, 3d8 cold, 3d8 electricity, 3d8 fire, and 3d8 poison damage} to creatures in the cone (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save). The animated dragonstorm can't use Channel Dragonstorm again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Destructive Strikes.name: Destructive Strikes
Destructive Strikes.description: The animated dragonstorm's attacks ignore the Hardness of objects with Hardness 20 or less.

Dragonstorm Strike.name: Dragonstorm Strike
Dragonstorm Strike.description: On a critical hit, the animated dragonstorm's fist bursts with dragonstorm energy. The target takes [[/r {1d6}[acid] + {1d6}[cold] +{1d6}[electricity] +{1d6}[fire] +{1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 acid, 1d6 cold, 1d6 electricity, 1d6 fire, and 1d6 poison damage}.

Ash Web.name: Age of Ashes
Ash Web.description: This dangerous sooty black mold readily releases its toxic spores when disturbed. The entire swath of fungus in area B2 is a single organism. There are nine 10-foot-square patches to remove, but the whole organism dies once it takes enough damage.
Ash Web.hazardDisable: @Check[type:survival|dc:27|name:Remove Patch|traits:environmental,fungus] (expert) to remove a 10-foot-square patch of ash web without triggering the spores
Ash Web.hazardReset: This large patch of ash web resets automatically at the start of the round.

Remnant of Barzillai.name: Remnant of Barzillai
Remnant of Barzillai.description:
Though the Silver Ravens defeated the evil tyrant Barzillai Thrune before he could fully realize his goal of becoming a genius loci, remnants of his spirit remain throughout the Ravounel region. On occasion, these scraps of sentience form a vague, Barzillai-shaped body from bits of the nearby terrain, but when near haunted locations, the spectral force can coalesce into a more precise body using ectoplasm siphoned from these haunts. In either form, the remnant carries a form of Barzillai's own burning mace, which dissolves into a thin mist 1 hour after the remnant is destroyed.

Remnants of Barzillai can manifest anywhere throughout Ravounel, and even after one remnant is defeated, another might arise later on. The undead inquisitor can be put to rest permanently only by retrieving his mace before it disappears, then burying it in a location consecrated by good clerics, where it must remain for at least a year undisturbed.

While a remnant of Barzillai can draw power from any haunt it is associated with, remnants tend to do so with specific haunts. The haunts presented are commonly associated with remnants of Barzillai. These are far from the only haunts Barzillai can create, however; the Silver Ravens' records mention many phenomena associated with the undead being, some of which deal with themes of various birds, the scents of mint and tea, and ghostly figures in heavy armor.

Haunted Form.name: Haunted Form
Haunted Form.description: The remnant of Barzillai draws on the power of haunts, reinforcing his form when they are nearby. His resistance to all damage increases to 12 while he's within 60 feet of a haunt. When a haunt within 60 feet of Barzillai is disabled, he takes [[/r {20}[force]]]{20 force damage} from the backlash.

Create Haunt.name: Create Haunt
Create Haunt.description:
Frequency three times per day

Requirements The remnant of Barzillai is within Ravounel.

Effect The remnant of Barzillai stirs up and amplifies unsettled spirits in the area to create a single haunt of 6th level or lower at his present location. This haunt is permanent until it is disabled or the remnant of Barzillai is destroyed.

Dragon Pillar.name: Age of Ashes
Dragon Pillar.description: A 10-foot-tall wooden pole topped by a wooden carving of Dahak's head. Each dragon pillar's head has been treated with something to give it a distinct color, as indicated in the specific encounter, but regardless of color, plumes of smoke waft up from the mouth.
Dragon Pillar.hazardDisable: @Check[type:athletics|dc:26|name:Push the Pillar Over|traits:complex,magical,trap,hazard] (expert) to push the pillar over, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:26|name:Erase Magic Runes|traits:complex,magical,trap,hazard] (expert) on the pillar to erase the magic runes that power it, or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level; counteract DC 22) to dispel the pillar's magic.
Dragon Pillar.hazardReset: The dragon pillar deactivates and resets as soon as it perceives no appropriate targets in range.
Dragon Pillar.hazardRoutine: (1 action) On its initiative, the dragon pillar fires an eye beam at the closest target within 120 feet.

Trapped Lathe.name: Age of Ashes
Trapped Lathe.description: The powered lathe's springs have been critically overwound so that when jostled or triggered, the lathe unwinds violently, hurling blades, gears, and sharp shards of metal around the room.
Trapped Lathe.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:31|name:Release the Spring Tension|traits:complex,mechanical,trap,hazard] (expert) on the lathe releases the tension on its springs without unleashing its blades and gears.
Trapped Lathe.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) The lathe attempts four sharpened fragment attacks against creatures in the room, selecting a target randomly from all available targets in area A1. The trap does not take multiple attack penalties for any of its attacks. The trap loses 1 action each turn as its springs wind down, and becomes disabled when it has 0 actions.
